overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>31.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Astronomers collect data for several moons in orbit around a distant planet. The data collected are the distance between the planet and each moon and the period of the circular orbit of each moon around the planet. The data are shown in the table.
content.question: Due to experimental error, the astronomers discover that the data for one of the moons are not consistent with the data of the other moons. Based on the data provided, which moon’s data are not consistent with the data of the other moons?

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
